IsDeployed.description: Airbag deployment status. True = Airbag deployed. False = Airbag not deployed.

Height.description: Height of lumbar support. Position is relative within available movable range of the lumbar support. 0 = Lowermost position supported.

Support.description: Lumbar support (in/out position). 0 = Innermost position. 100 = Outermost position.

Lumbar.description: Adjustable lumbar support mechanisms in seats allow the user to change the seat back shape.

Recline.comment: Seat z-axis depends on seat tilt. This means that movement of backrest due to seat tilting will not affect Backrest.Recline as long as the angle between Seating and Backrest are constant. Absolute recline relative to vehicle z-axis can be calculated as Tilt + Backrest.Recline.
Recline.description: Backrest recline compared to seat z-axis (seat vertical axis). 0 degrees = Upright/Vertical backrest. Negative degrees for forward recline. Positive degrees for backward recline.

Support.description: Side bolster support. 0 = Minimum support (widest side bolster setting). 100 = Maximum support.

SideBolster.description: Backrest side bolster (lumbar side support) settings.

Backrest.description: Describes signals related to the backrest of the seat.

Angle.description: Headrest angle, relative to backrest, 0 degrees if parallel to backrest, Positive degrees = tilted forward.

Height.description: Position of headrest relative to movable range of the head rest. 0 = Bottommost position supported.

Heating.description: Seat cooling / heating. 0 = off. -100 = max cold. +100 = max heat.

HeatingCooling.description: Heating or Cooling requsted for the Item. -100 = Maximum cooling, 0 = Heating/cooling deactivated, 100 = Maximum heating.

Height.description: Seat position on vehicle z-axis. Position is relative within available movable range of the seating. 0 = Lowermost position supported.

IsOccupied.description: Does the seat have a passenger in it.

Massage.description: Seat massage level. 0 = off. 100 = max massage.

Issuer.description: Unique Issuer for the authentication of the occupant e.g. https://accounts.funcorp.com.

Subject.description: Subject for the authentication of the occupant e.g. UserID 7331677.

Position.description: Seat position on vehicle x-axis. Position is relative to the frontmost position supported by the seat. 0 = Frontmost position supported.

SeatBeltHeight.description: Seat belt position on vehicle z-axis. Position is relative within available movable range of the seat belt. 0 = Lowermost position supported.

Length.description: Length adjustment of seating. 0 = Adjustable part of seating in rearmost position (Shortest length of seating).

Seating.comment: Seating is here considered as the part of the seat that supports the thighs. Additional cushions (if any) for support of lower legs is not covered by this branch.
Seating.description: Describes signals related to the seat bottom of the seat.

IsLessSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for less lumbar support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.Lumbar.Support).

IsMoreSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for more lumbar support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.Lumbar.Support).

IsLessSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for less side bolster support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.SideBolster.Support).

IsMoreSupportEngaged.description: Is switch for more side bolster support engaged (SingleSeat.Backrest.SideBolster.Support).

Backrest.description: Describes switches related to the backrest of the seat.

IsBackwardEngaged.description: Is switch to decrease seating length engaged (SingleSeat.Seating.Length).

IsForwardEngaged.description: Is switch to increase seating length engaged (SingleSeat.Seating.Length).

Seating.description: Describes switches related to the seating of the seat.

Tilt.comment: In VSS it is assumed that tilting a seat affects both seating (seat bottom) and backrest, i.e. the angle between seating and backrest will not be affected when changing Tilt.
Tilt.description: Tilting of seat (seating and backrest) relative to vehicle x-axis. 0 = seat bottom is flat, seat bottom and vehicle x-axis are parallel. Positive degrees = seat tilted backwards, seat x-axis tilted upward, seat z-axis is tilted backward.
